text: Has a nice strong hops aroma. Good foamy head in the glass, and a nice foggy orange body. Flavour is good hop notes with some fruit. Medium on the mouth. Decent enough, well made, adequately executed.
Tap at Beaus. Cloudy gold filmy head. Tangy wheat and spice aroma. Nice clove flavor with dashes of wheat and honey. The finish gives me fresh lime and citrus hop notes as well. A well-made brew.

Brown bottle, 600 ml, batch 5293, bottled on 09/01/16, gift from Jean-François Dugas (merci!), savoured on October 13 2016; eye: yellowish with a whitish hue, opaque, white head that turns into a ring, good lacing; nose: hops, citrus fruits, spices including coriander, yeast, pine, fresh; mouth: hops, citrus fruits, pine, spices including coriander, acidity, slight banana, dry finale in pine with presence of citrus fruits, medium body, quite carbonated, rather bitter, slightly sweet, slick texture; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 600 ml, lot 5293, embouteillée le 09/01/16, cadeau de Jean-François Dugas (merci!), savourée le 13 octobre 2016; il : jaunâtre avec une teinte blanchâtre, opaque, mousse blanche qui se transforme en un anneau, bonne dentelle; nez : houblon, agrumes, épices dont coriandre, levure, pin, frais; bouche : houblon, agrumes, pin, épices dont coriandre, acidité, très léger banane, finale sèche en pin avec présence dagrumes, corps moyen, très carbonatée, plutôt amère, très légèrement sucrée, texture coulante; en résumé : bien

Bottle, brought to me by Robbie (thanks!), shared at game night. Hazy lemony yellow, lively lasting white head. Bright hoppy profile, guava and tropical fruits, some peppery notes, clean lean wheaty backbone. Very drinkable. I had this a second time in the same week, shared by Shea. Really great stuff!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Draught at the brewery. Pours a hazy medium gold, with a smallish off-white head, which lasts well and leaves good lacing. The aroma has spruce and citrus hops, with some grain and white bread. Quite strong hops up front offer pine and grapefruit, leading into quite a light body, with a bracing pine finish. A nice, quaffable wheat ale.

Appearance: hazy straw with two fingers of loose white head diminishing gradually to a thick persistent cap, moderate lacing. (4/5) Aroma: citrus, melon, tropical fruit, wheat malt, clove and floral. (8/10) Taste: moderate sweet, mild bitter, light tart. (8/10) Medium-light body, moderate carbonation, medium duration bitter and lightly spicy finish. (4/5)

Aww yeah - hops you can smell from across the room upon decapping. Thats how you do a wheat beer! Lovely bright NZ hops impart fruity and almost vinous notes on a light, almost crisp wheat base. Id love to get this fresher, actually, even though it doesnt seem particularly faded. Another nice example of the Hopfenweisse style, right up there with Driftwoods Entangled, and really worth trying if you find it. (16/20)
Draft - Nice citrus peel and mango. Cloudy gold with a rich white head. Bright orange peel, mango and sweet tropical notes. Very unlike the style and very good.

On tap at Moon Under Water, pours a cloudy blonde with a small white head. Aroma brings out lots of fruitiness upfront, followed by floral notes and gentle hopping. Flavour is quite robust for the style, with plenty of stone fruitiness, floral and citrus hops, and biscuity malt. For a wheat ale, this is full of flavour. Nice stuff.
(bottle) cloudy pale yellow colour with a small white head; aroma of tropical fruit; balanced, refreshing flavour with a long, light bitter finish

600ml bottle pours a slightly hazy golden color with a finger and a half of white head that settles down to leave some spotted lacing on the glass. Aroma is citrus and tropical fruits with some yeasty and grainy notes. Taste is a spicy and citrus hop bitterness with a light fruity and malty sweetness. Light to medium bodied with good carbonation that tickles the tongue. Overall, a very well crafted brew that is like a hybrid between and German weisse and an American pale ale. Quite tasty and balanced.

Bière blonde, trouble avec une bonne carbonatation. Au nez, citron et levure allemandes. En bouche c'est très amer et très citronné, ça fait différent des allemandes standards. L'amertume devient de plus en plus présente au fil des gorgées, ce qui me confronte dans ma vision d'une weisse allemande. Pas ce que je préfère.

Hazy golden pour with pillowy white head. Gaily citrus hoppy aroma with yeast and a bit of cereal. More bitter than expected with lots of leafy green flavour mixed with yeast and creamy texture. Very good stuff.

Style non officiellement reconnu, la hopfenweisse de Beaus est asser atypique. Bellle couleur "blé voilé". Arôme bien fruité et herbacé, très léger en esther de bananes. En bouche cest plus herbacé que fruité. On dénote des fruits tropicaux et des épices quit me rappelle le thym ! Forte en alcool (6.8), elle surprend par son amertume bien tranchante en fin de bouche. Cest une hopfenweisse avec beaucoup de caractère, un peu trop pour une bière estivale. Cest néanmoins une excellente bière.

Pours hazy gold with a white head. Aroma is citrus right up front with a tropical fruit background. Flavour is creamy wheat and tropical fruits with a grapefruit bitter finish. I think I just found one of my favorite beers.

Bottle from LCBO. Hazy golden body with a medium white head. Lively carbonation. Faint lacing. Aroma of peach, yeast, white bread and lemon. Flavour of creamy malt and apricot. Medium body with a smooth mouthfeel. Soft fizz. Dry and tasty.

Draught at The Craft Brasserie. Decent wheat base with banana, clove and pepper mixing up nicely with a rich fruity hop bouquet, orange and mango, short bitter finish. Maybe not as full-bodied as I hoped, but a pretty tasty and enjpyable hoppy white.

600 ml bottle. Pours a slightly veiled pale yellowish straw with a thick, resilient white head. Aroma is tropical fruit, oranges, hoppy. Flavor is fruits, wheat, tropical fruit. Finish is grapefruit, bitter, lemon. Medium body, velvety mouthfeel, average carbonation.
Pale gold and a little hazy in colour. Fruity and citrusy, and perhaps a little spicy, with a clean hoppy bitterness at the end.

Dorée et voilée, une énorme mousse la recouvre. Des arômes fortement houblonnés, entremêlés de poire et de poivre. Une amertume sèche. Des saveurs de zeste de citron et de levure rustique. Ça pétille tout le long du passage au travers le gosier. Il y a de fortes stimulations pour le palais. (Emb. 25 mai 15 - Lot 4264) (1639-251015)

600ml bottle from Halles St-Jean. Aroma: loads of citrus mixed with wheat and some pepper. App: hazy pale, huge white head and shy lacing. Taste and palate: thin to medium body, resinous, a bit of banana in mouth, dry medium bitter finish. Overall: good but not a hefeweizen to me. Too bitter, too hoppy, not enough banana in the nose. Aside from that, its still easy to drink.
600 ml bottle from the LCBO. Pours a golden orange colour with a generous foamy white head. Aroma is wheat, bread, fruits, hops. Taste is same, plus banana. Very good beer.

Bière jaune tirant un peu vers lorangée, parfaitement voilée, bonne effervescence, et surmontée large col blanc immaculé, très dense et très mousseux, et qui se réduit tranquillement en laissant une certaine dentelle sur les parois du verre. Arômes de pain frais et de blé, de pâtisserie et de sucre brut, accompagné dévidentes effluves de houblon principalement fruité (orange et autres agrumes, mangue, cantaloup, pêche/abricot) présentant également quelques odeurs dherbes et/ou de conifère. Arômes aussi quelques peu épicés (clou de girofle, poivre mais également des odeurs plus herbacées, de la coriandre, etc) avec pointe de banane (esters de fermentation). Nez fort intéressant, complexité très élevée, mais intensité plutôt moyenne. En bouche, pétillement moyen sur la langue, mais onctuosité bien élevée sur la langue, on ressent très bien le velouté typique des bonnes bières de blé. Au goût, pain frais et pâtisserie, blé, léger sucré (miel et sucre brut), accompagné dun houblon fruité et résineux, en route vers une finale à lamertume de faible à modérée. On retrouve les épices et la banane en bouche, mais elle reste plutôt en arrière-plan, et on note également un alcool bien perceptible, peut-être un peu trop en fait. Mais autrement, léquilibre malt/houblon est fort intéressant, et lintégration des différentes saveurs entre elles est bien réussie. Belle complexité, et bonne intensité en bouche. Il sagit vraiment dune très bonne bière!
Solid orange gold pour. Big white head with lots of lacing. Good Hefe aroma of bannana, citrus, clove. Lightly sweet taste, spicy.

Pours cloudy straw with gold edges;the head is off white and foamy. The aroma has notes of: orange zest, cereal, coriander seed, and wheat funk. The taste is medium light bitter and lightly dry; the aroma notes carry through to the taste. The palate is medium bodied and has medium carbonation, with a medium finish. Overall, its more like a Saison than a wheat beer - still tasty though.
Strong aroma of cloves and assorted spices. I get plenty of banana, lemony citrus, more spices and a ton of epic smoothness. I like this beer a lot

Jaune, trouble, avec un bon col de mousse blanche. Nez dagrumes, de fines herbes, poivré et de levure. Goût poivré, de céréales, dagrumes et légèrement de fruits exotiques. Le tout se termine avec une finale qui laisse une douce sécheresse.
Bière blonde légèrement houblonner on sens de agrume Comme le citron , l ananas on sens aussi la céréales est très présent . C est une très bonne bière de saison je trouve
Little hazy pale yellow with a huge white head. Banana cake, mango, slight citrus notes, herbal. Nice sweet brew. Light body, creamy, lively carbonation with a dry finish.

Good day at the cottage. Sunny day. Crane and snakes sighted with the daughters in the canoe. Now quiet time inside while homemade pizza cooks in the oven. Time for a beer. What you would expect from a wheat in the looks department, except heavy on the soapy white foam. The nose is rich with hoppy resin, soft malts. The taste is heavy on the hops - resins, citrus and a little on the bitter, the German wheat comes through with some background citrus and softer wheat malts. Its a decent enough brew, but thats about all.

Surprenante, un genre de WIPA spéciale je suppose... Labricot et la gomme de pin sont bien présents et agréables. Leffervescence est inexistante, tout comme léconomie (9.39$ / 600 ml est très exagéré).

Bottle from flaveurs dici a: citrusy, banana, light cloves, light pineapple, peppery app: hazy golden thick white head with good lacing. T/p: med body with moderate long bitter finish with just a touch of acidity. Moderate carbonation. O: I got to admit Im a bit surprise. I didnt look the overall score before buying this one. Really well crafted nothing out of place its pleasant sip from first to last.

Bottle (600 ml) bought from La Duchesse dAiguillon. Thanks Minderbinder for the bottle! Split 3-ways with JulienHuxley and Luk_.

Appearance: Hazy bright golden with a medium white head, good retention and heavy lacing. 

Aroma: Nice spicy profile (cloves, but also light peppery notes), citrus and mangoes, bananas and fresh cereals. 

Taste: Rather spicy as well, but never cloying. Cloves, wheat, banana notes, crackery cereals, citrus and mild tropical fruits. Light bitterness.

Palate: Medium body. Medium to good carbonation. Spicy and peppery finish. 

Overall: The is legit top-50 material for the style. Really good hopfenweisse with a nice spicy profile well balanced by cereals and citrus/tropical fruits. Very easy drinking and super tasty. Well done Beaus!

Bottle shared with Tom. Hazy gold pour with foamy, lacy white head. Aroma is hoppy, bready wheaty notes, light spice, grapefruit zest, very fresh, moderate intensity. Taste is lightly bitter, very zesty, nice wheaty flavors, mild peppery notes, no banana/clove esters. Palate is med bodied with good carbonation. Tasty brew.

Pours a nice hazy gold with a white bubbly head. Bright citrusy aroma. Huge flavour on this beer! A beautiful thick and rich wheaty flavour with some cloves and herbal undertones, nice long aftertaste with lingering hops. Medium bodied, tingles your tongue slightly. Exceptional!
Couleur jaune paille opaque avec un beau col blanc. Aromes de fruits tropicaux comme la papaye et les agrumes, cereales. Correct mais je mattendais a un peu plus....

Robe jaune pâle trouble à souhait surmonté dun épais en invitant col de mousse blanche bien tenace. Arôme dorange, ananas, levures, citron, malt de blé légèrement sucré. On distingue même un côté sauvage, comme du foin, qui rapelle une saison. Le tout enveloppé dans des effluves de houblons tropicaux. En bouche, les houblons frappent fort. Bien fruité: orange, ananas, pamplemousse, resine de pin. Les saveurs sont franches et directes. La finale laisse ressortir des saveurs plus amères de pamplemousse ainsi quun côté de grains de céréales concassés. Texture mince-modérée, bonne effervescence pour ce type de bière. Loin dune grande bière mais les saveurs fruitées et rafraichissantes lui donne un quelque chose dintéressant.

Blond, trouble. Mousse crème aux bulles grossières. Odeurs citronnée agrémenté de céréales grillés et dananas. En bouche, belle amertume dentrée de jeu, suivi dune touche un peu surette qui permet aux effluves fruitées de se concrétiser. Rafraichissant, estival.

pours hazy light golden with a creamy reviving white head, good lacing. danky citrus, tropical fruits plenty, melons, orchard fruitiness - juicy pears, cloves and well-dosed bubblegums, perfectly ripened bananas, gently wheaty and peppery, honeyed lightly doughy maltiness, pineapple candies, chewy hefe yeast. average to light carbonation, light body - oily, balanced tropical-citrusy finish. über-tasty. very solid hopfenweisse - the closest to schneiders tap 5.

Un duvet de mousse bien généreux se dresse fièrement sur une bière dorée et orangée très embrouillée. Les houblons néo-zélandais effectuent leur besogne au nez, mais ils sont relégués au second rang par des effluves sulfuriques un peu désagréables, malheureusement. Par chance, cette impression de soufre est pas mal moins importante en bouche, ce qui permet aux houblons fruités et tropicaux de sexprimer. Lamertume est bien là, mais elle se pointe plus tard, comme une bombe à retardement. La levure allemande nest pas trop racée, ce qui crée une certaine lacune au niveau de la complexité des saveurs. Pas mal, mais y a mieux dans le genre.

Im not even gonna describe this beer: between the tasting notes up top, and my buddy Freaky_Tikis review below, pretty much all bases are covered. I will say that it was exactly what I was looking for on this hot, muggy night. I could chug a litre of this stuff. Beaus continues to rock my world lately, and this one goes near the top of their list. Deeeeeelicious.

Le liquide est de couleur paille, totalement opaque, avec une généreuse couronne de mousse blanche ; le nez rappelle une saison épicée, avec une finale houblonnée tropicale (pamplemousse, mangue). La bouche est dans les mêmes tons, sèche et fruitée à la fois, avec une bonne amertume qui clôt abruptement cette weiss à la buvabilité stratosphérique. Un brin de bananes se dévoile en arrière-plan. Une excellente bière dété, mais pas si facile daccès, de par ses saveurs franches et puissantes.

bottle. Poured hazy pale yellow with a thick white head. Definetly has a wheat aroma with hints of banana and some citrusy hops. Full bodied, a chewy mouthfeel with a lively carbonaton. Flavour is a balance of fruit and spice, with tart citrus and peppery notes, finishes with an astringent alcohol feel.

Bottle to stein
Lemon, tangerine, wheat, and rye. Clear light amber with a thin white head. Taste is lemon, wheat, hay, and yeast.

Apparence: D?une couleur jaune dorée, elle est coiffée d?une bonne mousse d?une bonne durée. Une bonne effervescence avec des bulles de petite taille. 

Arômes: Au nez, ce sont des notes de malt frais et dagrumes.

Saveurs: Au goût, cest une amertume bien présente, même trop car elle vient masquer tout le reste. Nul doute que cest le dry hop. Cest dommage et côté effervescence cest pratiquement inexistant au goût. 

Fiche technique 
Style: Bière de blé
Format: 600 ml
Taux d?alcool: 6% 
Température: 4°C - 6°C
IBU: 20

Bottle from LCBO. Pours a hazy gold yellow with a white head. Wheaty, yeasty, slightly spicy lemon aroma. Light body. medium carbonation. White bread, lemon, light bubblegum, light pepper, grass, light woodiness... Crisp, refreshing, quite dry. Nice.

Pours a light , filtered straw colour, with a medium sized white head, and moderate carbonation. Considerable lacing left behind as drunk.
Aromas of citrus, a light pepperiness, and a touch of Belgian yeast.
Taste wise Im getting mild citrus, a bit of banana, and light pepper (although far less pepper than their excellent Patio Saison).
Overall a very refreshing Hopfenweiss, and an excellent summer beer.  My fave Beaus label to date.

600 mL botttle. Mildly hazed straw with a thick white head. Aromas of tangerine, pomelo, key lime, canteloupe, banana and yeasty spice. Delicate malt sweetness and a balanced hop backbone that isnt all that bitter. Crisp and refreshing. Full carb and sticky mouth feel. Very nice.

This beer is no more or less than it describes on the label. Well done. Great label. Could use more yeast character for this style. Also surprisingly not that hazy for a hefeweizen, but that is neither good nor bad. Love the label.

Bottle: Poured a hazy pale yellow color ale with a generous white head with good retention and some minor lacing. Aroma of wheat malt with some tropical fruity notes is quite refreshing. Taste is also dominated by some good wheat malt with light grainy aftertaste and some medium tropical fruits notes. Body is quite full for style with good carbonation. Very enjoyable brew and probably and one that I could see myself purchasing again in the future.

ml bottle bought at LCBO in Hawkesbury on May 29, 2014. Straw, small head. Dry yeast aroma, notes of banana cream and cream soda. Taste of wheat and nectar, notes of herbs slightly dry. Not as nice as the wolf ont the bottle!

Cloudy yellow with ample white head. Barnyard aromas dominate but has a hint of citrus or corriander. Flavours are elegantly balanced: peach, orange, mixed berries giving way to a subtle yet warming vanilla toddy. Alcohol is incognito. Esti qucest Beau!

650ml bottle from the LCBO. Hazy pale yellow with a rocky white head that lingers. Nose has lots of wheat, citrus and banana as well as clove and pepper. Taste is sweet fruit with a fair level of spice throughout but not overpowering. A slight bitterness leading to a dry finish. Medium light mouth with active carbonation. Nice if a bit spicier than i would expect.

3 finger head once it fades its 1 finger or less & a little lacing. Veary carbinaded long time. Light watery yellow clear color. Smell I am not 100% sure how to discribe but taste wise as soon as I take some in hit with hop bitterness, resin and a grassy note. A little watery ale taste that gos away fast & then in the back a little banana taste. Sadly for the amount I drank so far, has veary briefly little tropical notes or none that is said to taste & others taste :( For me the majority of the beer is just a bitterness resin hop taste that last long and warms ya up a little. So, disapointed somewhat with this one a little. Wish I could taste the tropical notes. This beer was from Feburay acording to the date on bottle but found it this month that I am drinking it in.

600 mL bottle. Im gaining more and more appreciation for what this brewer is doing. Im not a fan of their regular offerings, and were making some odd choices at one point. But recently their one offs and seasonals have become more consistent. Im still, however, not a fan of the big, expensive bottles. This one is a well hopped wheat ale with an interesting floral note both in the aroma and in the flavour.

Once again this company does not disappoint. It takes a few minutes after pouring this beer for its full flavors to come out. Beautiful aromas of minty-grassy hops and Belgian Ale yeast, after the banana notes from the wheat fade out. Nice dry mouth feel from the hop, but still refreshing. Citrus fruits taste, but not on the crazy bitter-side. It has a pleasantly bitter and dry IPA like finish. Medium body with lively carbonation. Really impressed by its cloudy dark gold color and great long lasting white head.
Nice hoppy and weissy aroma. Taste is much the same, complex with nice wheaty burn finish. Very nice.

600ml bottle. Cloudy golden yellow with a frothy white head. Flavors are banana, tropical fruits, wheat, cloves, citrus and bubblegum with herbal and floral notes. Medium body, moderate-high carbonation, creamy texture.

600ml bottle from LCBO. Newmarket, ON. Pours a hazy pale gold colour with two finger of lasting white head. Foamy lacing clinging to the side of the glass. 
Aroma is banana and some oranges.
Taste matches the aroma. Wheat beer characteristics are noticeable. It has a pleasantly bitter and dry IPA like finish. Medium body with lively carbonation.

Wags out of the bottle into the glass a cloudy marmalade with a one finger white as rice cap. Its banana Popsicles on the nose & squeezed citrus & bubble gum on the tongue. Notes of pepper, tropical fruit, & juicy hops. Carbonation is cranked up to 11. An interesting take on the wiessbier style. If youre not a fan of the style -- or if  the uber hipness of Beaus is too unhip for you right now -- youll surprise yourself (and nod your head & say "yes, Freaky Tiki, you *were* right this time") when you pour one of these into your own glass.

Picked up at the brewery for me. Pours a hazy light-golden colour with a big frothy white head, great retention and lots of foamy lace. Beautiful aromas of minty-grassy hops and Belgian Ale yeast, after the banana notes from the wheat fade out. Nice dry mouthfeel from the hop, but still refreshing. Citrus fruits taste, but not on the crazy bitter-side. More like grassy, again minty, and not much of the wheat here. Again, quite refreshing though. A great hoppy wheat ale.

Bottle from the brewery. Hazy straw yellow with an ample creamy white head. Aroma is bang on for the style - the expected weiss notes of banana and clove, overlayed with inviting citrus and tropical fruit character from the hops. The flavour leans more towards the hoppy side of things, but a bit of banana still comes through before the citrus, pineapple and lychee notes from the hops come on strong. Really fantastic!

Tap in Bar Hop. Light hazy yellow, medium shortish lasting head. Some fruity yeastiness, long bitter finish with a slightly sherbety hop bitterness. Quite clean. Tasty, good, enjoyable, would maybe prefer a bit more complexity from the yeast.

Tap at Bar Hop. Pale yellow colour. Hazy with a thick sticky white head. The aroma is lovely - bright fruity hops and a touch of noble earthiness as well. Pronounced clove and light banana/pear esters that work well with the hops used. Full bodied and quite juicy. A solid brew.

600 ml bottle from Savvy Hip Hops. Pours a cloudy pale straw colour with modest-sized but lasting white head and decent lace. Aroma is wheat, banana, clove and a floral note. Flavour is chewy wheat, lots of banana, some tropical fruit, clove and flowers. Finishes rather dry. Pleasant.

Hazy golden pour, big, thick, white head. Straight up german hefe nose, bananas, cloves, and grassy wheat, and some solid piney hops. The hefe similarities end at the look and aroma. Flavour is green, bitter hops. Pine resins mixed with malted wheat. Medium to high bitter finish.

Pours a very cloudy dark golden colour with a large rocky white head leaving good lace up the glass. Aroma is fruity, citrus, bready, notes of banana, and clove. Flavour is citrus, mild bitterness, bready, tropical fruits, yeast, sweet and then dry. Good take on a wheat beer though not my favourite style.

Thanks to cfrancis for this one. Pours a cloudy orange with a bright white head and a bunch of lace. Aroma of wheat, yeast passionfruit, sweet tropical hops, slight sourness and a few floral notes. Taste is wheat, yeast, tropical fruits and goes from sweet to dry. Bunch of stuff going on in this one pretty decent overall.

600 ml bottle from Brewery via cfrancis (thanks!), served cold in a tulip glass. Notes from memory...forgot to add rating.
App.: Cloudy golden with a so-so head.
 
Aroma: Plenty of malt, some esters, a distinct lack of hop notes.
 
Palate: Medium body, somewhat relaxed effervescence.
 
Flav.: More malt, light esters, Beaus rustic character, meh; dry, fair bitterness and a sorta vaguely estery finish.

Weak Wolf.

Bouteille de 600 ml partagée lors dune dégustation Ratebeer Montréal. Arôme: Odeur de banane et dagrume. Apparence: La couleur est blonde légèrement voilée avec une moyenne densité de bulle. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût dagrume avec une pointe de banane et dépices. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une textuer légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement houblonné. (Rating #4995)

[5165-20130323] Tap. Banana bread and yeasty aroma. Murky, light tan body with a quick foamy white head. Yeasty bitter banana bread flavour. Medium-full body seems boozy. Interesting to try. (7/3/7/3/14) 3.4
(Beaunly Cafe Event @ The Only Cafe, Toronto, ON)

Of all the trend of hoppy hefeweizens Ive had lately this is probably the least impressive. More of a wheat ale than a very hoppy beer. Pours cloudy blond with ok head and lacing. Average carbonation. Some aroma of banana and only the slightest hops. On tap at Barhop.

(On draught at Brydens, Toronto ON, June 14th 2013) Pours a very cloudy yellow with a fluffy/ white head that didnt last. Aroma has fairly restrained citrus hops that werent particularly bitter/pithy (NZ style) and a little fruit over top of a strong core of banana, a bit of clove, herbal notes and some wheat malt. Hopping doesnt over-power the hefe character. On the palate there is some bright citrus and tropical fruit juiciness to augment the yeast, banana, wheat, bubblegum and spice of the hefe. Moderately sweet to start, but a decent bitterness for the style builds and it finishes dry with hops and powdery yeast. Medium body, fairly heavy prickly carb but fairlly on-style. Good weizen with the hop character adding to the experience without overpowering it.

Pours a hazy straw yellow with a big pillowy white top.  Aroma is astringent floral and citrus hop with wheat.  Taste is bright citrus and floral hops with wheat chewiness.  Not a bad beer but not their best.

Bottle - 600ml. Cloudy golden body with a thin white foamy head. Decent malty/hoppy aroma with piney and coriander hints. Its fresh hoppy taste carries piney and citrusy notes. Ends with a good bitter/herbal finish. Not bad.

Bottled March 27th. Props on the new plastic labels rather than the old ones that ripped extremely easy. Pale yellow. Aroma of clove and banana, as well as some citrus from the late hop addition. Taste of bubblegum, spice, banana, and just a small touch of mangos. Medium carbonation, oddly bitter. Overall a nice summer beer. Light and refreshing.

My Bottom Line:
Citrus fruit, flowers and bubblegum coalesce over banana esters in this creamy Hopfenweiss.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A creamy tower of foam protects the cloudy pale blond.
-The dosage of hop resins and overall hop character with the fermentation character is perfectly done.
-The fluffy carbonation and healthy sugars make for a highly drinkable example.
-The citrus fruit character is reminiscent of lemons as much as starfruit.
-The finish is moderately bitter.

Bottle.

On tap at Brydens. Pours a hazy yellow with a good amount of fine white head that dissipates quickly. Smell is fairly sweet with a good amount of wheat, cloves, and a tiny bit of citrus. Palate is light bodied with slightly below average carbonation. Taste is pretty good, slightly sweet at first before getting a bitter kick that appears again in the tail end of the sweet aftertaste. Good, but theres definitely better choices.

On tap ar Bar Hop. Hazy pale yellow with a nice slightly off white head. May not be a fair rating since I was drinking it besides a freshly poured Dennisons but o well. Wheat, yeast, some banana, light floral and citrus hops. Moderate but smooth body and carbonation, interesting balance of bitterness and a touch of sweet, pleasent.

On tap at Bakers Street Station, Guelph.  Looks like grapefruit juice - gold-coloured and super cloudy.  Aroma of wheat and vanilla.  Taste has wheat, banana, spice, with a pretty harsh bitter and alcoholic finish.  Surprising since the IBUs and ABV arent that high.  Decent body.  A good enough wheat beer.

On tap @ Hintonburg Public House Ottawa. Pours a hazy yellow with a small white head. Aromas are tropical fruit (mango, banana). Tastes are banana, clove, and a little bit of pine resin throughout but most assertive on the finish. Medium body and carbonation and medium bitter finish. Interesting wheat beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy
Not a bad wheat beer, on tap at Bar Hop. A tad funky smell and taste, which adds to drinkability.  Lacy. Middling mouthfeel.

2013/04/19- Pours a hazy straw color, with a frothy white head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is yeast, banana, cloves and citrus. Taste is yeast, banana and cloves up front with a bitter, citrus aftertaste. Mouthfeel is medium with prickly carbonation and a crisp, drying finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bouteille 600ml. De couleur dorée foncée et voilée. Nez de levures fruitées (bananes, moyen dagrumes, traces de mangues) et épicées (clou de girofle, traces de poivre), de gomme balloune, moyen de blé, moyen-léger de houblon herbeux (herbes fraîches) aux notes citriques (citronnées) avec des traces de pain. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen ainsi quune texture aux notes crémeuses. Goût de levures fruitées (agrumes, moyen de bananes) et moyennement épicées (clou de girofle, léger de poivre) avec des petites notes de gomme balloune et de houblon herbeux lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût de blé avec des traces de pain. Parallèlement, lamertume de houblon se développe pour devenir plutôt moyenne, avec un caractère plus herbeux et légèrement citrique (zeste dagrumes) jusquen finale.  Post-goût moyen, léger-moyen amer de houblon herbeux avec un goût de levures fruitées (zeste dagrumes, moyen de pelures de bananes) et légèrement épicées (poivre doux) ainsi quavec des traces de blé.

Smells of yeast, banana and pine. Medium bodied with Resiney hop and a little wheat sharpness, decently balanced

Pale yellow, small white head. Smells like a grassy hefe - tastes like a really grassy hefe - fruity, moderate alcohol, grassy and a bit
Minerally, average body, chewy, fruity and yeasty - bloody good, quite a bitter aftertaste.

A hazed murky blonde to yellow weizen with a thin lacing off white head. In aroma, nice fruity banana and cloves, talcum, and spices. In mouth, a nice banana malt with silky mouthfeel, Belgian hops, nice and bitter, cloves, well done.

Draught at Bar Hop. Pours a murky yellow with an average size semi-lasting frothy white head. Interesting and nice aroma of wheat, bubblegum, a good amount of grassy hops, pepper, lemon and plenty of yeast. Flavour: Wow, Id avoided this beer cause Im not a big Wheat beer fan but Im glad I gave this a chance, I quite like it. Yeasty, herbal and hoppy along with lemon, wheat and an average bitter finish. Average to medium bodied. Not only was this better then I expected but I will have it again -- good stuff.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2013 2013-06-19. Hazy orange body modest white head and lace. 3+ Aroma has a fair bit of grassy hops, light wheat touches, light whispers of lemon. 7+ Flavour is pleasant, sweet lightly yeasty pale malt core, pleasant hoppy over layer has moderate fruit and grass, whispers of Hefe like esters?  Average plus bodied palate, good carbonation. 3+ very drinkable. Shines more with less yeasty character, very enjoyable. 7/3/7+/4/16+ - 3.7 On tap at Bar Hop, Toronto
2013-03-23. Murky orange juice like body, small white head. 3+ Very hoppy yeasty character to the aroma. Interesting flavour, a lot of yeast mixes with fairly bitter hops, giving it a lingering bitterness long into the finish. Light lemon and grass undertones. Average plus to medium bodied palate. 3++ Im told the bottled product will be less yeasty, which will likely add a increased level of nuance to it since the flavour at this point is dominated by yeast and hops. Enjoyable, Id happily drink it again as is so I am curious to try it again if I get a chance. 7/3/7/4/15 - 3.6  On tap at Beaunly Event, Only Cafe, Toronto
